content: अस्त {%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} {@--1@} Thrown, cast, given up, left; असमये यत्त्वयास्तोऽभिमानः <ls>Ve. 6.</ls> {@--2@} Finished. {@--3@} Despatched. --स्ता <ab>Ved.</ab> A missile, an arrow.

अस्तः [अस्यंते सूर्यकिरणा यत्र अस्-आधारे क्त] {@--1@} Setting or western mountain (behind which the sun is supposed to set); अधिरोढुमस्तगिरिमभ्यपतत् <ls>Śi. 9. 1</ls>; विडंबयत्यस्तनिमग्नसूर्यं <ls>R. 16. 11</ls>; यात्येकतोस्तशिखरं पतिरोषधीनां <ls>Ś. 4. 1.</ls> {@--2@} Sunset. {@--3@} Setting in general; (<ab>fig.</ab>) fall, decline; see below. {@--4@} Conjunction of a planet with the sun: शक्रास्त, बुधास्त &c. --स्तं {@--1@} Home, abode, residence (<ab>Ved.</ab>); <ls>Rv. 7. 1. 2</ls>, <ls n="Rv.">10. 34. 10.</ls> {@--2@} Death, end. {@--3@} The seventh house (in <ab>astr.</ab>); (लग्नात्सप्तमं स्थानं). --स्तं {%<ab>ind.</ab>%} At home, home; अस्तं गम्, --या, --इ, --प्राप् ({%a%}) To set, decline in the western horizon; गतोस्तमर्कः the sun has set; (<ab>fig.</ab>) it is time to do the duties to be performed at sunset; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} for a cowherd to drive home his cattle, for a religious person to begin his prayers, for a thief to begin his nightly work &c.; कथमिहवै युवयोरस्तमितः सूर्यः <ls>V. 3</ls> and <ls>Sarva. S. 1.</ls> ({%b%}) To cease, vanish, be removed, disappear, be at an end; विषयिणः कस्यापदोऽस्तं गताः <ls>Pt. 1. 146</ls>; धृतिरस्तमिता <ls>R. 8. 66</ls>; दंडेनास्तमितत्विषा <ls>Ku. 2. 23</ls>; अस्तमितैषा कथा <ls>K. 156</ls> at an end, over; <ls n="K.">198</ls>, <ls n="K.">204.</ls> ({%c%}) To die; अथ चास्तमिता त्वमात्मना <ls>R. 8. 51</ls>, <ls n="R.">12. 11.</ls>
